Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> Me I understand "All privacy coins leak drastically more metadata than we thought" but what is the metadata that leaks?  IP of user and?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> everything

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Alice, Bob, their amounts, their unique id's

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> all useful metadata is leaked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> everything you tried to keep private

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gilardh zaddrs leak who is sending and receiving and the amount

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and monero is likely not drastically better, but seems that it will be more costly to mine the data, vs zec world

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and none of this is an attack against one address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <phm87> ``i'll read it and pretend to understand it`` I'll do the same but I may have more questions after reading the ELI5 ^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's an attack against the entire chain. You *must* attack/study the entire chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> by doing that, you correlate all possible metadata

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and extract maximum metadata

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's metadata extraction, where no metadata was thought possible to extract

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> kind of like Meltdown/SPECTRE for blockchains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> since blockchains with only taddrs are all public already, it's not much for them. But applied to privacy coins, it's catastrophic

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <phm87> future zonly chains may be fixed so no future metadata leakage maybe

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But past metadata cannot be removed from the blockchain. Blockchains do not forget, once notarized ðŸ™‚

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Chains with longer history have more technical metadata debt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @phm87 and no, "no future metadata leakage" does not seem likely, near-term

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's gone apocalyptic

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we are now in the "Walking Dead" phase of privacy coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @phm87 they are unfixable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <1112> You mentioned if you send to 2 or 3 addresses, with only 0 or 0.0001 HUSH, and never spend the 0.0001, then that disrupts the analysis chain. So in the client, if you check a box, have it send 0 or 0.0001 to a multi-sig wallet, where it is impossible for the user to accidentally spend it. The user sets up the other sig in deep storage offline somewhere.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <phm87> What if they adds schnorr and/or CT ? Does it also apply to these tech ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @1112 you have a good idea, and i have indeed explored that line of reasoning into many places ðŸ™‚

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> something like that is one part of the mitigations. except there will be no box to check

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> switching to a new chain doesn't fix anything

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it could reduce some metadata, but damn it's a lot of work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> our goal is to improve things going forward. We have one of the newest Zcash chains around, anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the first pure sapling chain!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't know of a newer/smaller zec fork, actually. Maybe arrow?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> is that still a thing?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I think various other chains will want to have similar stuff as Hush will implement

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they will need to do some work, because I am not writing any sprout stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> Patch leak and then only after switch in a new clear blockchain. Yes it's a lot of work.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so we have a bit of a lead on everybody, since we have no sprout. I only need to write half the code they do ðŸ™‚

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gilardh it's not patching a leak. we have to drastically change everything we do in the future, to hope to make it to annoying/costly to ruin our privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> there are no "fixes"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's cat-and-mouse

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> as computers get faster, we will need to ratchet up defenses in the future

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> metadata can be mined, and we must make it as hard, complex and costly as possible to mine metadata about the Hush mainnet. That is the goal.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i have some really fun weird stuff cooked up. i don't fully know the implications of it all. that is why we call it "research" ðŸ™‚

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's really nice to answer questions, I have been thinking about this stuff too much. If anybody wants me to clarify something, please, ask away.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <1112> for the last 50k blocks, almost nobody uses HUSH to pay or get paid. So many empty blocks mined. Just collectors accumulating, miners mining. 

The way the de-anonymization analysis was explained, it appears you can manually wash your funds by sending in the same transaction HUSH dust to one or more addresses which you will never use again. So that is a quick fix for anyone whose wallet is working right now.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @1112 that is not a very good "fix"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's something, but it's not a great solution to ask every Hush user to manually add that stuff to every xtn

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @1112 you are right that most of the current hush blockchain is mining, many empty blocks, and taddr usage. our shielded pool is growing but still small since we had a total reset in April when me migrated to the new chain
